poem:
In Memory of Frank O'Gorman  

History's voice yet whispers  
through lecture halls,  
where Frank once stood,  
an old oak in the grove.  
His books, a bridge  
across time's river,  
the eighteenth century unfolds,  
his tone a steady guide—  
Now silence claims  
his gentle authority;  
Only pages breathe  
the echoes of his mind.
